Commands.Documentation: Animates fading a character out over time, until they are completely invisible.

Parameters.Name: character
Parameters.Documentation: The character object to be faded out.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds it takes for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Commands.Documentation: Animates fading a character in over time, until they are completely visible. Works on characters who were invisible when they were spawned in.

Parameters.Name: character
Parameters.Documentation: The character object to be faded in.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds it takes for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Commands.Documentation: Animates graying out a character over time. Good for showing a character isn't the current focus of the conversation.

Parameters.Name: character
Parameters.Documentation: The character object to be dimed.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds it takes for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Commands.Documentation: Animates a character changing from grayed out back to their default sprite. Good for showing the character is the current focus of the conversation.

Parameters.Name: character
Parameters.Documentation: The character object to be undimmed.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds it takes for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Commands.Documentation: Animates moving a character to a given stage position using a speed in units per second.
Commands.Signature: char_move character stagePosition speed smoothLerp waitForAnimation

Parameters.Name: character
Parameters.Documentation: The character object to be moved.

Parameters.Name: stagePosition
Parameters.Documentation: The stage position to move the character to. The available stage positions are: OffscreenLeft, FarLeft, Left, Center, Right, FarRight, and OffscreenRight.

Parameters.Name: speed
Parameters.Documentation: How many 'units' per second the character should move at. Units are roughly equivalent to a pixel on the screen.

Parameters.Name: smoothLerp
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the move animation should be 'smoothed out', gradually speeding up at the start and gradually slowing down at the end. Makes the animation appear more natural, like how a person moves. The animation time is unaffected.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Commands.Documentation: Animates moving a character to a given stage position using a fixed animation time.
Commands.Signature: char_move_time character stagePosition animationTime smoothLerp waitForAnimation

Parameters.Name: character
Parameters.Documentation: The character object to be moved.

Parameters.Name: stagePosition
Parameters.Documentation: The stage position to move the character to. The available stage positions are: OffscreenLeft, FarLeft, Left, Center, Right, FarRight, and OffscreenRight.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds it takes for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: smoothLerp
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the move animation should be 'smoothed out', gradually speeding up at the start and gradually slowing down at the end. Makes the animation appear more natural, like how a person moves. The animation time is unaffected.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Commands.Documentation: Deletes a character object from the scene.

Parameters.Name: character
Parameters.Documentation: The character to be deleted from the scene.

Commands.Documentation: Deletes all visual effects from a character.

Parameters.Name: character
Parameters.Documentation: The character that will have all their visual effects cleared.

Commands.Documentation: Deletes a visual effect object from the scene.

Parameters.Name: effect
Parameters.Documentation: The effect that will be removed from the scene. Only the first effect with the given name will be removed, and all effects are given the same default name if no custom name is given at creation. Make sure the effect you want to remove is given a custom name when it was created or else this command may not work correctly.

Commands.Documentation: Switches which of two characters is dimmed. Useful for cutting down the number of char_dim and char_undim commands when the autodim system is disabled.
Commands.Signature: char_dim_alternate firstCharacter secondCharacter animationTime waitForAnimation undimFirstCharacter undimSecondCharacter

Parameters.Name: firstCharacter
Parameters.Documentation: The first of two characters to be switched between.

Parameters.Name: secondCharacter
Parameters.Documentation: The second of the two characters to be switched between.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds for the dimming and undimming animations to complete.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Parameters.Name: undimFirstCharacter
Parameters.Documentation: If true this forces the first character to be undimmed. Useful for setting the first character to be undimmed without needing an extra char_dim or char_undim command.

Parameters.Name: undimSecondCharacter
Parameters.Documentation: If thrue this forces the second character to be undimmed. Useful for setting the first character to be undimmed without needing an extra char_dim or char_undim command.

Commands.Documentation: Immediately sets the background image to the named sprite. Best used at the start of the script when the starting image needs to be set.

Parameters.Name: imageName
Parameters.Documentation: The name of the background image to be loaded.

Commands.Documentation: Animates switching from the current background image to a new one.

Parameters.Name: imageName
Parameters.Documentation: The name of the background image to be switched to.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Commands.Documentation: Creates a blackout effect on the background effect layer, which fades to black over time. Background effects only affect the background image. Blackout objects are automatically deleted when a fadein effect is used on the same layer.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Parameters.Name: name
Parameters.Documentation: The name that the effect object should have. Used for identifying the effect in other commands (example: vfx_clear).

Commands.Documentation: Creates a fadein effect on the background effect layer, which fades from black over time. Background effects only affect the background image. Fadein effects are automatically deleted after completing their animation, since they are invisible.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Parameters.Name: name
Parameters.Documentation: The name that the effect object should have. Used for identifying the effect in other commands (example: vfx_clear).

Commands.Documentation: Creates a blackout effect on the foreground effect layer, which fades to black over time. Foreground effects only affect the background image and the characters. Blackout objects are automatically deleted when a fadein effect is used on the same layer.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Parameters.Name: name
Parameters.Documentation: The name that the effect object should have. Used for identifying the effect in other commands (example: vfx_clear).

Commands.Documentation: Creates a fadein effect on the foreground effect layer, which fades from black over time. Foreground effects only affect the background image and characters. Fadein effects are automatically deleted after completing their animation, since they are invisible.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Parameters.Name: name
Parameters.Documentation: The name that the effect object should have. Used for identifying the effect in other commands (example: vfx_clear).

Commands.Documentation: Creates a blackout effect on the screen effect layer, which fades to black over time. Screen effects affect the entire scene, including the dialogue window, so be careful when using this. Blackout objects are automatically deleted when a fadein effect is used on the same layer.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Parameters.Name: name
Parameters.Documentation: The name that the effect object should have. Used for identifying the effect in other commands (example: vfx_clear).

Commands.Documentation: Creates a fadein effect on the screen effect layer, which fades from black over time. Screen effects affect the entire scene, including the dialogue window, so be careful when using this. Fadein effects are automatically deleted after completing their animation, since they are invisible.

Parameters.Name: animationTime
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds for the animation to run.

Parameters.Name: waitForAnimation
Parameters.Documentation: Whether or not the cutscene should wait for the animation to complete before continuing to the next line or command.

Parameters.Name: name
Parameters.Documentation: The name that the effect object should have. Used for identifying the effect in other commands (example: vfx_clear).

Commands.Documentation: Deletes all visual effects on the background layer.
Deletes all visual effects on the foreground layer.
Deletes all visual effects on the screen layer.
Deletes all visual effects on all characters in the scene.
Adds a speedline visual effect to a chosen character.
Commands.Signature: vfx_char_speedline character duration color radius name

Parameters.Name: character
Parameters.Documentation: The name of the character the speedline effect will be attached to.

Parameters.Name: duration
Parameters.Documentation: How long the visual effect should last in the scene. At the end of the duration the effect is deleted. The default value of -1 means the effect will be persistent, and will stay until you clear it manually.

Parameters.Name: color
Parameters.Documentation: The color the lines of the speedline effect should be. The default color is black, like in most comics or anime. The value given is a hexadecimal in the html color format; that means for a color represented by red, green, blue, and alpha, the pattern you should use is #RRGGBBAA.

Parameters.Name: radius
Parameters.Documentation: The radius of the speedline effect. Roughly determines how far from the effect's center the individual speedlines will be drawn.

Parameters.Name: name
Parameters.Documentation: The name that the effect object should have. Used for identifying the effect in other commands (example: vfx_clear).

Commands.Documentation: Adds a new named character object to the scene.

Parameters.Name: objectName
Parameters.Documentation: The name of the character object you create. Used for referencing this object in later commands (example: <<char_add 'Lana' ...>> for <<char_move Lana ...>>).

Parameters.Name: characterName
Parameters.Documentation: The name of the sprite you want to use for the character. Character and npc sprites are supported.

Parameters.Name: position
Parameters.Documentation: The stage position that the character will be spawned at. While this argument can be null, the character's position will eventually have to be set in order to display correctly so you might as well set it here if there's no good reason not to.

Parameters.Name: visible
Parameters.Documentation: If true then the character will be visible when spawned. If false the character will be invisible, and a char_show command will need to be used to make them visible.

Commands.Documentation: Removes all created characters from the scene.
Tells the Yarn Spinner system to wait until all ongoing animations are complete before continuing to the next command or line.
Sets the default animation time for the autodimming system.

Parameters.Name: time
Parameters.Documentation: The time in seconds for the dimming and undimming animations to complete.

Commands.Documentation: Enables the automatic dimming and undimming system. While the system is active, any character with the same name as the speaker will be undimmed, and all other characters will be dimmed.
Disables the automatic dimming and undimming system. Characters will have to be dimmed/undimmed manually with the char_dim, char_undim, and char_dim_alternate commands.

While the autodimming system is off, turning this on will allow the char_dim, char_undim, and char_dim_alternate commands to use the default autodimming animation time. While on any value you pass in for the animationTime argument will be ignored.
Sets the char_dim, char_undim, and char_dim_alternate commands back to their default behavior, ignoring the autodim animation time.
